results.title: A matter of survival: toxic solvents
results.creator_credit: R Hurley, J Sherman, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description:
In this 1963 film we see the dangers of working in contact with benzene vapours in a science laboratory. Most of the footage takes place in the CSIRO Chemical Research Laboratories, where the scientists enact scenes to show the safety precautions that should be observed, including avoiding breathing the vapours; avoiding spilling the liquid; replacing stoppers in bottles; washing hands; and always using the fume cupboard when pouring the liquid. The film includes an animated opening sequence, an ominous metronomic soundtrack to indicate levels of danger and footage of female scientists in the laboratory.

Produced by the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (CSIRO) Film Unit.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Happy birthday
results.brief_description: Touching dedication to a mother by her eldest child, her only son. Scott talks of his close relationship with his mum, of their journey together through dark times, of change and survival and finally a second chance at life, love and family.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Extending boundaries
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Merna Curnow, raised on a farm, always wanted to be a teacher. She never considered herself as a farmer, not even when she married a third generation farmer of the Curnow family. Teacher, mother and supportive wife until one day she suffered an identity crisis when helping her husband out on the farm. That day became a turning point in Merna’s life.

group.title: Against the grain: digital storytelling project

results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 07
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. The RAAF flight in the Antarctic use Canadian “Beaver” aircraft. 2. RAAF personnel are trained by firemen in Melbourne. 3. The Lockheed Hercules transport. 4. The “Jindivik” pilotless aircraft, designed and built in Australia, shown in flight at Woomera range.

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Game Masters: Hideo Kojima interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Hideo Kojima speaks about his career as a designer and producer of video games at Konami Digital Entertainment and Kojima Productions. At a time when mainstream action games only focused on attack and defeat, ‘METAL GEAR’ (1987) introduced infiltration into the gameplay and became one of the earliest examples of a stealth game. In 1998, the first 3D title in the ‘Metal Gear’ series, ‘METAL GEAR SOLID’, was released, integrating the most advanced stealth-based gameplay yet seen with cut-scenes that reflected Kojima’s passion for cinema. ‘METAL GEAR SOLID’ became a worldwide best seller and was followed by three successful sequels.

NB: This interview was conducted in Hideo Kojima’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
